docs.snippet: Clues to global intrigue in the Instagram account of a jailed prostitute.

headline.print_headline: The Trump-Russia Story Gets Even Weirder
headline.main: The Trump-Russia Story Gets Even Weirder

docs.snippet: Two new books examine the modern presidency and the possibility of removing Donald Trump from office.
It’s always nice to think about a different president.
Also: Another gun loophole that is worthy of activists’ attention.
The president might want to actually use the office, not just occupy it.
Also: A poll shows how Americans really feel about education.

headline.print_headline: How to Respond to a Trump Twitter Tantrum
headline.main: How to Respond to a Trump Twitter Tantrum

docs.snippet: In John Bolton, the president has found an adviser whose facial hair sends a message: Negotiation is for wimps, and so are razors.

headline.print_headline: Donald Trump, Mustache Lover at Heart
headline.main: Donald Trump, Mustache Lover at Heart

docs.snippet: Readers discuss the president’s leadership style (“feckless, thin-skinned, petulant”) and the controversies surrounding many of his advisers.

headline.print_headline: The Chaos in the Trump Administration
headline.main: The Chaos in the Trump Administration

docs.snippet: “It’s time to act,” said Kirstjen Nielsen, the secretary of homeland security, as she outlined the policy during a White House briefing.

headline.print_headline: Trump Will Work With Governors to Deploy National Guard to the Border
headline.main: Trump Will Work With Governors to Deploy National Guard to the Border

docs.snippet: The power the president gave his daughter and son-in-law upended a basic principle of American democracy and is sowing chaos in his administration.
